document.title: AVEVA InTouch Access Anywhere and Plant SCADA Access Anywhere

revision_history.summary: ICSA-22-130-05 AVEVA InTouch Access Anywhere and Plant SCADA Access Anywhere

product.name: AVEVA InTouch Access Anywhere: All versions
AVEVA Plant SCADA Access Anywhere (formerly known as AVEVA Citect Anywhere and Schneider Electric Citect Anywhere): All versions

branches.name: AVEVA Plant SCADA Access Anywhere (formerly known as AVEVA Citect Anywhere and Schneider Electric Citect Anywhere)

cwe.name: Exposure of Resource to Wrong Sphere

notes.text: Windows OS can be configured to overlay a language bar on top of any application. When this OS functionality is enabled, the OS language bar UI will be viewable in the browser alongside the InTouch Access Anywhere and Plant SCADA Access Anywhere applications. It is possible to manipulate the Windows OS language bar to launch an OS command prompt, resulting in a context-escape from application into OS.CVE-2022-1467 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.4 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:L/UI:N/S:C/C:L/I:L/A:L).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Disable the Windows language bar on the server machine hosting InTouch Access Anywhere and Plant SCADA Access Anywhere applications unless it is required.
Create unique user accounts with minimal privileges dedicated only to remote access of InTouch Access Anywhere and Plant SCADA Access Anywhere applications.
Utilize OS group policy objects (GPOs) to further restrict what those unique user accounts are allowed to do.
Restrict access based on Microsoft's recommended block list.
For more information on this vulnerability, including security updates, please see security bulletin AVEVA-2022-001
